alternatives.transcript: a sixty two year old female patient presents ed with a chief complaint of shortness of breath patient reports gradual worsening and shortness of breath palpitations and feeling like passing out over the past two months she visited her primary care physician three weeks ago where tests were conducted but her symptoms continued to worsen symptoms didn't improve with rest but worsen with physical activity the patient mentioned sleeping on a chair at night to alleviate the symptoms patient has a history of pulmonary sarcoid sarcoidosis and hypertension she currently takes lisinopril ten milligrams and prednisone ten milligrams she does not have any known allergies and she does not use any substances such as tobacco alcohol illicit drugs she does consume one cup of coffee per day the patient reports a balanced diet exercised regularly but much less since her symptoms started she works as an elementary school teacher is in an monogamous relationship and has insurance and also support at home on physical examination the patient appeared well developed well nourished fatigued awake and orient notable findings include elevated jugular pain distension a systolic murmur murmur rails and one plus pitting edema of the lower extremities bnp was elevated at four hundred four thousand chest x-ray showed pulmonary edema and medial spinal cordless echo showed restricted cardiomyopathy with a fifty percent fifty five percent injection fraction the ekg was suggested of a non sustained v tach with normal sinus rhythm and overall the sixtieth year old male female with a history of pulmonary sarcoidosis and hypertension presenting worsening shortness of breath palpitations near fainting episodes demonstrating signs of volume overload and restrictive cardiomyopathy so for her plan we decided to admit her for telemetry with a diagnosis of sarcoidosis restricted cardiomyopathy and three on the nyha scale considering the seriousness of her condition there was no known drug allergies to be noted and vitals were to be closely monitored at two hours the patient will be encouraged to engage in mobility with assistance nursing instructions are strict intake outtake monitoring daily weight measurements dvt prophylaxis and the use of oxygen via nasal cannula to maintain oxygen saturation over ninety six percent the patient will be placed on a low sodium diet to manage fluid retention iv fluids will be administered via saline lock to keep vein open rate at a keep vein open rate medications will be continued as previously prescribed including lisinopril ten milligrams qd and additional med medication will be initiated such as amiodarone one hundred and fifty milligrams iv and an increase in prednisone to sixteen milligrams q q d and furosemide iv forty milligrams a comprehensive metabolic manner will be ordered overall organ function consultation with interventional cardiology will be made for consideration of an aicd placement and a consultation with nuclear medicine radiology will be arranged for a fge pet scan to further evaluate the sarcoid the patient will be advised to maintain a healthy diet work towards weight reduction and avoid strenuous physical activity until released by the physician cuts
